page.title: 05WALKING DAY
page.content: The first recorded Warrington Walking Day was in 1834. It was started as a counter-attraction to the Newton Races. Walking Day is a procession of witness to the Christian Faith. All the churches and Sunday Schools of the town unite in a parade through the town - led by the parish church (St. Elphin's). The walk is held annually on the nearest Friday to the beginning of July. 1985 saw the 151st. Walking Day. More than 6000 men, women, boys, girls ,clergy,bandsmen,choirs,scouts,cub etc. paraded through the town. Thousands more lined the streets to watch. Tradition has it that new clothes are worn for the walk. During the walk children and adults are given money by friends. Unfortunately the true meaning of the day now seems to be lost.
